items.title: Define product strategy
items.description: Establish long-term product vision, goals, and roadmap aligned with business objectives.

items.title: Gather user requirements
items.description: Collect and analyze customer feedback, needs, and pain points through research and interviews.

items.title: Prioritize product features
items.description: Rank feature importance based on user value, business impact, and development effort.

items.title: Create user stories
items.description: Write detailed user stories with acceptance criteria to guide development teams.

items.title: Analyze market trends
items.description: Research industry developments, competitor activities, and emerging market opportunities.

items.title: Coordinate cross-functional teams
items.description: Facilitate collaboration between engineering, design, marketing, and sales teams.

items.title: Track product performance metrics
items.description: Monitor KPIs, usage analytics, and success metrics to measure product effectiveness.

items.title: Conduct stakeholder meetings
items.description: Present product updates, gather feedback, and align expectations with key stakeholders.

items.title: Manage product backlog
items.description: Maintain and refine the prioritized list of features and improvements for development.

items.title: Validate product concepts
items.description: Test product ideas through prototypes, user testing, and market validation techniques.

items.title: Write product specifications
items.description: Create detailed technical and functional requirements documents for development teams.

items.title: Plan product launches
items.description: Coordinate go-to-market strategies, marketing campaigns, and launch timelines.

items.title: Analyze user feedback
items.description: Process customer reviews, support tickets, and survey responses to identify improvement areas.

items.title: Negotiate with vendors
items.description: Discuss partnerships, integrations, and third-party service agreements for product features.

items.title: Monitor competitor products
items.description: Track competitive landscape and analyze rival products for feature gaps and opportunities.

items.title: Facilitate sprint planning
items.description: Lead agile ceremonies to define sprint goals and select backlog items for development.

items.title: Create product roadmaps
items.description: Develop visual timelines showing planned features, milestones, and strategic initiatives.

items.title: Conduct user interviews
items.description: Interview customers to understand their needs, workflows, and pain points directly.

items.title: Optimize conversion funnels
items.description: Analyze user journey data to improve conversion rates and reduce drop-off points.

items.title: Manage product pricing
items.description: Develop and adjust pricing strategies based on market research and competitive analysis.

items.title: Ensure regulatory compliance
items.description: Verify product features meet industry standards and regulatory requirements.

items.title: Coordinate beta testing
items.description: Organize and manage beta user programs to test new features before public release.

items.title: Develop business cases
items.description: Create financial justifications and ROI analyses for new product investments and initiatives.

items.title: Mentor junior product managers
items.description: Guide and train less experienced product managers on best practices and methodologies.
